text: the man whose voice is heard on the
recording is mr. sterling now the
question is will LA Clippers owner
Donald sterling sell this could move
swiftly the next steps after the NBA's
aggressive move today on the New York
Times minute Donald sterling is now
barred from all NBA and clipper
activities as for his ownership I will
urge the board of governors to exercise
its authority to force a sale of the
team he paid 12 million dollars for the
team in 1981 this year forbes valued the
franchise at about 575 million dollars
so if he is forced to sell the team it
will be an enormous payday for him and
yesterday was also an important day for
Adam Silver the new NBA commissioner
he's been in the job for just two months
and many were questioning how he'd
respond to this crisis so far early
reviews from players owners all
foreigners have been saying that silver
handled this really impressively and
confidently and swiftly I think they
were just happy that it was a resolution
and it's over and for the clipper
organization all this drama comes at a
climactic moment for the team they've
been terrible for 33 years and now they
find themselves deep in the first round
of the playoffs with a real chance to go
further Tuesday night's game a
drama-filled clipper win means that the
team has a real chance to move on
